newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Arnotts notes priced 32 bp over July 00-SBC.
newsitem.headline: Arnotts notes priced 32 bp over July 00-SBC.

text.p: SBC Warburg said on Monday the A$100 million note issue it lead managed for Arnotts Ltd from its A$200 million debt programme were priced at 32 basis points over the Commonwealth Government July 2000 bond.
The issue yield was 5.99 percent, SBC Warburg said. The notes pay a 5.75 percent coupon and mature August 15, 2000. Settlement is on July 17.
When the issue was announced last week, the notes were to carry a 6.0 percent coupon.
SBC Warburg Executive Director, rates, Ron Ogden said the coupon was dropped as the issue yield was coming in under 6.0 percent, reflecting the recent strength of the bond market.
"It was just coming in under the six percent, so we decided, with Arnotts, to drop the coupon to get it to a price discount," Ogden told Reuters.
Ogden said SBC and Arnotts were "absolutley delighted" with the issue.
"It's gone extremely well. There's definitely a hole in people's portfolios for well-rated corporate names. This is just an absolute winner for them," he said.

This is the first issue undertaken by Arnotts, which is rated AA-minus by Standard & Poor's, and is also the most highly rated non-government owned corporate bond launched in Australia to date, SBC Warburg said when the issue was announced.
The full A$100 million were issued, and SBC said there was good demand for the notes.
"We were well-oversubscribed on our ticket, and I dare say the other dealers were much the same, so there's definitely good demand out there for this sort of paper," Ogden said.
Arnotts is about 70 percent onwed by Campbell Soup Co .
Co-managers for the issue are Westpac Banking Corporation, Commonwealth Bank of Australia and Citisecurities Ltd. SBC Warburg is also arranger of the debt programme.
